description: Surface form belone +‎ -phobia. From Ancient Greek βελόνη (belónē, “needle”) + φόβος (phóbos, “fear”).

entries.meaning: An irrational fear of needles and pins, usually resulting in abnormal behavior and anxiety.
examples: "That's the medical name for it, trypanophobia?" He heard the scholarly curiosity in her voice and knew she was writing it down, probably to research it the first chance she got.
